abstract: Kenneth R. Feinberg is planning to disclose the salaries for the 25 most highly paid employees at many major companies, according to TheStreet.com.
snippet: Kenneth R. Feinberg is planning to disclose the salaries for the 25 most highly paid employees at many major companies, according to TheStreet.com.
lead_paragraph: Kenneth R. Feinberg, the Obama administration’s executive pay czar, is planning to disclose the salaries for the 25 most highly paid employees at a variety of companies within 30 days, according to TheStreet.com, citing comments attributed to him in an analyst’s research report. They include Citigroup, Bank of America, the American International Group, GMAC, Chrysler Financial, General Motors and Chrysler.

headline.main: Pay Czar Said to Plan to Disclose Top Salaries
